I can write the gunshot, I can write the hospital scene - but getting them to that hospital I struggle with cuz I feel like I need to fill in the gaps in every little space possible. 

In tv good direction can help cuts seem non-jarring 

In writing I just need to be better lol

For example, in a tv show you can cut from someone laying on the ground with a gunshot wound, to them being rushed into the hospital

I feel weird doing that in writing cuz it’s like choppy af. Maybe I just need to learn how to not write in extreme detail

Maybe I’m just not there as a writer yet, but one thing I really struggle with is transitionary moments in a story. I always found it difficult to write the inbetween. 

It’s something I envy about tv and movie production, cutting between scenes just seems a lot smoother/easier

@Alex20040618 The editor isn’t the sole blame but at the same time you can’t just give them a pass. 

Not that it matters - the problems with MHA lately probably have a lot more to do with things like burn out - but tbh I don’t think we would have gotten 327 if we still had PLW’s editor

@Alex20040618 It’s not really about forcing people to write things it’s about leading to (or not being competent enough to pick up on) things like pacing issues, things in the plot getting forgotten, certain things getting more time and writing then others

Criticism is best when it’s healthy - stop antagonizing all discussion  - present opposing opinions and arguments instead and we can have a real discussion over it 

If you disagree, that’s fine, it’s the nature of criticism and discussion - just actually discuss?

The very basis of Literary Criticism is rooted in Interpretation  

I’ve spent too much of my time reading and analyzing MHA to be told I’m making up my own version of the story

Stop pretending like anyone actually trying to criticize MHA is just making things up in their head and not reading the story 

There is thematic precedent, narrative backing, multiple arcs of set up, writing that directly backs the validity of the criticism.

Never bring this type of argument into a literature class you’d get thrown out

Criticism is quite literally - by definition - the analysis and judgment of the merits and faults of a literary or artistic work.

Real Criticism ≠ HeadCanon Crying https://t.co/1c0Wp6F5Ue

@taylorann112 If 327 was stretched out and instead of his trauma being reduced down to him needing to accept help from his friends, we actually explored why Deku acted the way he did throughout Villain Hunt - I would have very little if any complaints about the arc

@taylorann112 I count 327 as the end of Villain Hunt - i agree I think Deku being hyper focused during his time by himself in VH was fine. However, after the kids in 1-A spent a long time expressing how Deku is damaging himself and pointing out his self sacrificial behavior - it’s not explored

@AnikiSmashFSP @taylorann112 Which is exactly why it would have been great to see it explored after Deku was brought back to UA. Unfortunately we got 327 instead - I would’ve been 100% fine and satisfied with Villain Hunt if Deku’s trauma they spent 20 chapters shining a spotlight on was explored

@AsarathaHS I think some readers are adjusted to good and bad being very distinct and when presented with both perspectives they feel as if the story is trying to go “the bad guys are actually good” 

When in reality it’s not really saying that at all, it just *feels* that way (I think)

@AsarathaHS Which I think is purposeful but that’s besides the point 

You see it from Shigaraki/Toga’s perspective, it’s a lot easier to justify or look at them as the “good side” especially if it’s a long arc that runs into a bigger arc that continues those themes

@AsarathaHS I think people have a hard time understanding that when you tell a story from a certain perspective, the perspective is going to a lot of times come across as the “right” one to a lot of the general audience 

MVA is the perfect example. same with EA, MHA jumps around a lot lol
RT @AsarathaHS: Feel like people are always under the impression that MHAs trying to make it's villains seem "correct" rather than just sho…

So when people are upset at not having seen Dekus point of view or perspective - understand that it’s not just mindless hate of criticism - it’s coming from a place of high expectations 

Expectations the series set for itself

Deku is the main character of the series, and for a long while the assumption was Deku’s character was taking the slow burn route when it came to his underlying issues and character arc relating to that 

The series set itself up perfectly to execute that, and it didn’t happen

Yes, we have seen Deku’s perspective many times throughout the story of MHA. No one is really arguing we haven’t

However, it is not unreasonable at all to have expected a Solo Deku arc to fully dive deep into Deku’s POV and perspective on his own life and experiences https://t.co/iTN6oR5g8n

Just a lot of people tend to act like those fanonized versions of the characters are canon and then get let down when they aren’t given as much as focus as expected

The characters in question were written specifically to fill that background or “side” role, it’s purposeful 

That makes these character “well written” - even if most of them are little more then archetypes - it’s purposeful with which makes them good in context

And then people get upset cuz _____ is not getting screen time or there isn’t enough focus on ____

To me - it makes a lot of sense that Toga would try and immediately confess and express her love towards Deku 

Why would she risk disappointing herself? Why would she want to ask a question  that’s only given her pain

She loves Deku, she’s acting on her desires, that’s it

A lot of people are wondering why Toga didn’t start the conversation with the same question she asked Ochako

The way I interpret it - Toga has only ever been told that the way she sees things is wrong. The first time she asks someone she loves - Ochako - she gets the same answer https://t.co/Ych8SgNvJk

The last time Toga tried to ask her question and rationalize with someone she loved - she was essentially told her entire view and life was wrong.

@brain_goes_boom You’re right and that’s what getting me, because I feel like that impact is impossible to avoid because at that point it’s not even the original persons impact - but the people who are inadvertently dehumanizing’s impact. And then you have to look at their intention as well
Sorry lol

I shouldve probably phrased my initial tweet better for this - what I’m talking about is 

When a persons intent is good, and the impact of their action isn’t necessarily harmful or damaging, but because of anonymity, people will antagonize and not treat others like human beings
@Gy_ro_ Really I’m just rambling sorry lmao

@kingkuyk Which - in tandem - kinda leads into what I’m really getting at 

Which is that the internet, social media in general, oversimplifies things and dehumanizes even the smallest of users - and that creates a lot of toxicity I think

@kingkuyk You get people treating that hypothetical person as this seriously terrible figure - when in reality their intentions and person are great on every aspect. 

You are definitely right, but I think different situations have different contexts that change things

@kingkuyk Now that person didn’t know what was happening and even if they did their intent wasn’t to overshadow anything or “deprive information” as some people like to argue 

So that’s a situation where there is virtually no impact, the intention was good, and yet…

@kingkuyk I agree kinda, but now you gotta think about it through the lense of a situation where the impact is not harmful  

Imagine someone posting art they worked 20+ hours on or something, but when they posted it something really terrible happened like the Ukraine situation….
@Alex20040618 Now we are getting somewhere!

@Gy_ro_ And it leads to that nature of how the internet is so anonymous and how anyone can say anything - when in reality 80% of the things people will say on here they probably wouldn’t openly be like that in a real life scenario

I think looking at celebrities and…

@Alex20040618 So it’s like the internet is a big gallery where anyone and everyone can come up and just saying anything - even the nicest and most well intentioned “influencers” or “celebrities” can get shit on for nothingS Which I think is probably the cause of a lot of mental health issues.

@Alex20040618 Like, for example, let’s say an artist worked 20+ hours on a painting and they posted it. It’s not rare you’ll see some weirdos start quoting and shitting all over the artist and their art as if it were a painting in a museum - when in reality they person can see all of that

@Alex20040618 I think that’s less about being critical and more about holding yourself to a certain standard. And for sure, I get that a lot. 

In terms of how other people perceive others work and stuff - I think it boils down a lot of times to what I was talking about with the dehumanization
Sorry for rambling on lol, this type of stuff really interests me and it’s really hard to talk about it anywhere other then where it’s happening cuz I don’t think anyone else could understand? idk

It’s this weird phenomenon where it’s almost like as soon as a person has an audience (big or small) they become this dehumanized figure of discussion 

And I’m not talking about billionaire world destroying fuckers no - I mean obviously well intentioned influencers and celebs

I think everyone having a somewhat “private” platform (from the eyes of whoever they are talking about) can be both good/bad for discussion 

but I also think influencer culture and more importantly the dehumanization of celebrities and popular entities has played a big role.

It’s also mainly because I can’t really figure out whether it’s just the internet that’s enforced this idea that it doesn’t matter what the person *meant* - or if it’s something that’s more akin to how toxic discussion in general is 

I’m pretty sure I know this but still

The obvious answer is it’s a mixture of both but I’ve been wrestling with this for a bit.  

The thing I’m getting stuck on is whether or not this is the result of how social media has created people with mini-platforms… and how much that shoots up a persons ego big time.

I’m curious, if anyone sees this, do you think intention is more important then outcome? Or do you think intention doesn’t matter? 

I’ve been seeing a lot of logical fallacies lately from well intentioned people directed at other well intentioned people. 

It’s kinda weird.

just realized I just ranted about this topic without really answering the original tweet 

bad writing = anything someone dislikes about a story. Be it a character, plot, inconsistency, etc.

The issue comes in when you are trying to present your opinion in a serious and constructive manner, and you don't elaborate on that opinion.

Its hard to take people seriously when u use an umbrella term without elaboration is my point lol

Articulation is important when discussing shit cuz if you cannot articulate your grievances and complaints (or ur likes)  then there is no way for anyone to learn or get better from it 

Not to say ur a POS if u use basic terms, its not like that

And don't get me started on "bad"

I can call the ending of AOT "bad writing" and in the next sentence say "MHA has bad writing"

What's the difference there? Nothing, they are the same when looked at with zero context - which is the issue 

No nuance, no actual discussion

AND THEN there is an entire discussion to be had on what people mean when they say "bad" or "lazy"

You can't call these terms descriptive cuz wdym by that??? Lazy? Do you mean the author didn't edit his work enough? Or are there inconsistencies? Or is it just not good enough?

It's borderline disrespectful

It's the reason people like CinemaSins are so hard to respect. They ignore the broader story's writing and focus on tiny details that don't matter for the overarching narrative trying to be told.

"That clock is out of place! +5 sin!!" like stfu

Personality? The Actions the characters take? How they interact with each other and their environment 

SOOOOO much shit goes into writing a story that when someone goes "bad writing" most of the time they are talking about something so small in the broader scale of the story

What about the use of figurative language? Imagery and the descriptive language used to portray it?

Or are you talking about grievances on the character writing? A particular character arc perhaps? Or maybe you're referencing inconsistencies in the writing of a character

IMO however, if you are seriously critiquing a story's "writing" you would elaborate on what that means depending on your opinion.

Writing and Bad/Lazy can mean so many different things. Are you talking about world-building? The dialogue between characters? Grammar?

I think "bad writing" or the term "writing" in general is really an umbrella term that can mean a lot of things.

However, most of the time when people say something has "bad writing" - they are probably talking about major plot details and/or character writing. Most of the time. https://t.co/9OQ09D1EYk

Also its funny and probably a coincidence but I like how Aoyama and Gentle both are like extra, european-ish and dress all dapper like they are constantly at a tea party 

Doesn't give any credibility to the connections these two characters have narratively, but its pretty neat https://t.co/bQwPYjTqze

It would be even better if we also get to touch on stuff like quirklessness in this little Aoyama plot line because it would be a good way to not only bring attention to a big problem that hasn't gotten much screen time - and also give more insight on Deku's perspective/character

It is a solution to a problem I always thought MHA had with the direction its going. Which... is pretty much this.

How do you "Fix Society" without coming off unrealistic, fairy-tale ish, and cliche?

I think this type of thing is how you do it going forward tbh

So Deku being able to save Aoyama - who effectively acts as a Gentle 2.0 in the story - works at creating solutions towards society and these different aspects that are failing people (gentle, shiggy, toga, etc.)

Which, is really smart writing imo
of course, these two aren't directly the same circumstance so the details are different but I hope you get my point kinda

Then we take Aoyama and it follows a lot of the same beats but switches around the details. Aoyama is now a "villain of circumstance" because he was a good guy who couldn't become a hero, it wasn't possible for him

...but it IS possible for him to be a villain (just like gentle) https://t.co/qaTWNEfP3T

But we can also apply this to the individual villain circumstances that line up with a lot of the stories themes 

Gentle Criminal, for example, hits a lot with the idea of "villain of circumstance/letdown" 

A good guy becomes a villain because being a hero isn't possible https://t.co/4kl1TVVkli

In a way, it feels like Aoyama is going to be the "version of Gentle" that Deku gets to save and set on the right path. 

A lot of MHA I think is correcting the wrongs of the past and being better than before for the future.

AFO, Shigaraki, the whole Society discussion applies

The Aoyama traitor plot-line is actually some of Hori's best work in a long while when it comes to staying on track with themes and whatnot 

To explain, I think Aoyama and Gentle actually have quite a lot in common when it comes to their circumstances and narrative roles. https://t.co/5NBzq1AmRQ

@WarriorKayla So when it comes to Aoyama it is definitely a special case that's nuanced in the eyes of the reader - because we know Aoyama isn't a "bad" person at heart - but because of what happened his actions led to a lot of bad things

And also be respectful to Horikoshi

We can all be bitter, we can all criticize decisions, we can make as many threads on our dislikes as we want but at the end of the day we don’t know the situation. There are hundreds of factors that can play in here 

He’s human, not a robot.

I don’t think I have to say this but - this is MY opinion. 

Don’t start saying I hate MHA. Don’t start saying I hate Deku. 

I’m just trying to have a discussion surrounding my favorite character. That’s all.
MHA has always been a “slow burn” when it comes to this stuff - lately (and this is just my random observation) it feels like it’s kinda given up that approach cuz it’s maybe too taxing? Idk.

I feel like with Deku, Villain Hunt and 327, we have gotten the spark notes. I want to read the entire thing.

Of course - this can kinda still all be fixed - but with every “I hope you’re enjoying the final act” we get - it’s less and less easy to confidently say it will happen https://t.co/or3kXCrCpD

Once again - there’s 320+ chapters of set up for Deku’s character that has been carefully interwoven throughout the story 

And it still hasn’t been executed 

…at least not in a satisfying way that makes sense with Deku’s character.

If that’s true, Deku’s character should be working towards a satisfying conclusion that puts him in a better place then he’s been - Villain Hunt felt like the start of that. 

But in the end - so far - it’s rushed to a “band-aid solution” and seemingly moved on towards the finale

If we were, say, in the middle of the story? I wouldn’t be worried because you still have all this time to continue this character arc with him 

But - we keep getting told that we are in the last act. The final arcs of the series. https://t.co/y8wFRI0X5N
Don’t just leave it for the reader to interpret / guess indefinitely and then never tell us.

But getting back to Deku 

If this band aid solution were to be taken seriously at all - we should be seeing it from Deku’s perspective. 

Show us Deku’s thoughts on his current situation. Show us why Deku’s mental health still isn’t better (or if it is? - show us WHY it is) https://t.co/jx25oUiA1c

****And this would be kinda fine if it was maybe stretched out a bit more - you can keep the happy times but instead of trying to wrap in 7 different plot lines in a 16 page chapter - spread it out maybe???****

327 feels like a Filler episode in the middle of a war arc

Deku’s mental issues have been shoved aside and bandaged by having support from his friends. 

All tension has been removed around the class as all of their trauma has been either glanced over or seemingly non-existent

*save for Todoroki lol

And these kids (not just Deku) have been through some shit. So to make it feel like there’s this bubble of happiness in the middle of a falling country is betraying the last 326 chapters of buildup a chapter like 327 should have started executing https://t.co/SCgHrkWAVr

And what didn’t happen? 

We didn’t get a deeper perspective on Deku’s psyche

We didn’t get a satisfying All Might and Deku reunion that justified such an emotional parting 

We didn’t get a more mature and nuanced discussion surrounding anything thats happened to these kids

327 is…. a funny thing really

The reason why a lot of people point to this chapter as a new low for MHA is not because of what happened in the chapter 

But because of what didn’t happen

And if I was taking this chapter seriously, I would look at Deku saying this as even further proof that he isn’t “healed” and, if anything, his mental health is still a very very big concern when it comes to his own safety

But I can’t take the chapter seriously, for many reasons

Deku isn’t truly messed up because he didn’t have all might or support from his friends

Deku is messed up because of years of systemic oppression, because he grew up idolizing and then getting mentored by one of the most self sacrificial heroes to ever exist. It’s his character

I would love to be wrong about this in the future - but what it feels like is Deku just went through an entire character arc that’s been set up since chapter 1 without even once really thinking about it himself 

What’s even scarier is it looks like Deku hasn’t even progressed https://t.co/CuPFXQgiSE

And when I say all it takes is a chapter or two of these things being addressed for it to be exponentially better - I’m not really exaggerating 

Villain Hunt was such a disappointment for some people because it felt like we were going to get this. But we didn’t, not really. https://t.co/PwDzJbZ1SN

I can make threads detailing Deku’s mental health, his own perspective on things, the deeper working of his character and why he acts like he acts

But even if all of this is “within” the story - if the story never actually brings it up and talks about it - there is no point

And what I mean by that is it feels like we are being given all of the puzzle pieces, but we literally can’t put them together yet 

Perpetual Set-Up, No execution

My issues with Deku aren’t in his existing writing, the pacing of his arcs, the fact that he “doesn’t care” about the bullying, nothing like that. 

It’s the simple idea that a lot of what makes his character deeper and more interesting comes from audience driven interpretation https://t.co/8bp6wSdDZu

In this Nekoma v Karasuno match especially I think we can see how each team has improved with their setters development - especially Karasuno 

I can always appreciate when the writing behind specific characters ripple out naturally and realistically - always makes it feel earned

And we see overtime in the series how Kageyama has worked and grown with his cooperation and teamwork skills - and then we see with Kenma how he has worked on his athleticism and stamina - and that reflects in Karasuno and Nekoma as teams

It’s really an interesting thing to see how the setter “makes the team” in a sense - not necessarily 100% true all of the time but Karasuno and Nekoma are both shaped incredibly by how their setter operates

He had to learn to rely on his teammates and that whole cooperation side of things never came natural to him. 

Both characters have these weaknesses (Kageyama lacked in cooperation, Kenma lacked in athleticism) and it really does ripple out throughout their team

Kageyama and Kenma are really interesting characters imo because they foil each other quite well 

What makes Kenma a great setter has been his ability to rely on his teammates and work in tandem with his team - Kageyama was always a lot more independent as an athlete https://t.co/i85udhyFeh

unfixable issues

Nowadays I really am just looking forward to the voice acting, the music, and the occasional Sakuga. And it sucks, cuz I used to be able to look forward to it all but it’s just not the same anymore. 

I’ll still love the anime but it could be SO much better and that’s what sucks

It’s like riding a bike compared to riding a motorcycle. They both are fun to ride, but at the end of the day once you start riding a motorcycle the bike starts to feel slow and pointless. 

That’s kinda been my relationship with the MHA anime and manga - and honestly it’s sad

And it’s not like I don’t like the anime. I do. But after reading the manga and having these expectations - on top of the production issues and various reasons why it isn’t as good as it could be, the anime has knocked itself off its own pedestal.

I don’t pretend to know the reasons behind these production decisions and I’m not blaming animators or studios when there are hundreds of factors that go into making anime - but there’s something very obviously wrong in the production and it’s just sad to see

Shits sad too cuz idk if it will ever get what it deserves. 

The thing is, it isn’t bad. And that’s the problem. It’s just…. passable?

I love how the conditions have changed and how we even see it with heroes retiring for different reasons 

And yet, 1-A were immediately ready to follow Deku on his path of danger - and it’s largely in part of Deku’s influence on the whole class.

ESPECIALLY when I’m sure at the start of the year when the kids were getting into the hero course - not all of them had ever thought of being a hero solely to save people. There was always money, fame, fortune, other incentives to think about 

But not anymore and I love that

So for Tsuyu (and in tandem the rest of 1A) to confidently announce they would follow him on that path of “fiction” - it’s just such a powerful line not only for the meaning of friendship within the 1A class - but also how they are willing to go so far for Deku’s sake.
Especially since now - where the world of MHA is - being that self sacrificial hero is something that is much more realistic then it used to be when society was stable

But Deku was written to be the perfect “comic book hero” - an image of self sacrifice that isn’t nearly as common in the MHA verse 

So for Tsu to bring up comic book hero fantasy’s in this really powerful quote - it’s just really on the money for Deku’s character - I love that

This is such a powerful line cuz the Comic Book Supehero stereotypes (like Spider-Man for example) are much more self sacrificial and they are by the nature of their story 

In MHA - a hero doesn’t need to risk their life to be a hero - it’s normally just another job https://t.co/XmWJeJ2z7J

Even small stuff like the color contrasts of the TV’s representing Shigaraki and Deku being on either side - happening to parallel each other’s positions. 

I like how it’s always prominent that Hori thinks a lot about his decisions as an artist, an author, etc. https://t.co/eFVUFzBtdq
I am such a huge fan of the color palettes that Horikoshi chooses in his color pages - he’s really good at thematically showing subtlety through color choice https://t.co/rnkog8HnzB

@AbhiDragonite Essentially, coloring from a beginning standpoint is learning how to fill in the lines correctly. From there, it’s learning how to shade and make things look realistic in the given setting. It takes time and you can only get better by doing it more and more, great work so far!

@AbhiDragonite So what I would do, is try making everything in a coloring a lot darker then you’d think. Working with layers makes this easier because you can always change each part a lot faster. But from the dark colors, try and determine the light sources, and build to lighter colors

@AbhiDragonite Sometimes when doing this you’ll find that there is just a lot of darkness and no light source. This is where shading and lighting come in big, in this panel for example, the light source is mainly the lightning from OFA around Deku.

@AbhiDragonite So for example, the panel u colored has a darker tone behind it with both the meaning and the general moment in story. so making the surrounding buildings and the sky a darker tone can help to build that atmosphere
@AbhiDragonite Hey great job! I still consider myself pretty novice at coloring but one thing that helped me a lot when I was trying to get better was working on lighting and atmosphere.

@X3Zayed Hey awesome job! One way you can work on improving is start working with reflectivity on surfaces. For example, the full cowling lightning emits a bit of a glow, so adding that and making sure the surfaces it is next to reflect that light a bit will make the colors pop even more!

I guess that means objectivity is a social construct. Cuz for a large group of people - their opinions come from reading other peoples opinions online. So while THOSE people may be the true subjective thinkers - objectivity only occurs when those thoughts are shared in mass

Cuz realistically can there be studies done that mass test peoples base opinions? No. Because literally everyone has been conditioned by media and their own upbringings/nurture to like what they like. So itd be near impossible to test that without there being big margins of error

Any singular person can have a different perspective/opinion/pov

I guess that ends up being a question of what objectivity actually means

Maybe it can only exist when there is a group of opinions. Unlike if it was only ever singular people forming opinions without outside input

The more you think about it the harder and harder it gets to prove objectivity exists when it comes to fictional works. 

Idk, something about how while yes, something can be majorly agreed upon to be objectively good, even a perfect creation is judged through subjective eyes

idk - I might be reaching but I think a lot of this lines up very well. I could really see something like this happening and I dont think its a coincidence that all of this comes up exactly 100 chapters after Deku vs. Kacchan part 2. 

Just seems too perfect to me - but who knows

Its a role reversal 

Bakugo - the person who used to despise the idea of receiving help from Deku is now the one who wants to give it

Deku - the person who had always received help from others and was thankful for it, now doesn't want it and doesn't feel he needs it https://t.co/muNzOjrQ8B

Now, look at the potential Deku vs Kacchan Pt. 3

Bakugo just saved Deku at Kamino Ward - Deku has been shouldering the responsibility all on his own shoulders for the longest time and being reckless. Bakugo is about to challenge that ideology and try get Deku to receive help https://t.co/RbxddeURUK

Look at Deku vs. Kacchan part 2.

It started from Deku saving Bakugo at Kamino Ward - which then led to Bakugo initiating a fight over not only his own feeling of inferiority but his guilt over All Might and not being strong enough https://t.co/fmtqKA6h1m

So, I think it is very likely we get a Deku vs. Kacchan Part 3 

They have clashing ideologies, they have a reason to fight (Deku not wanting Bakugo or anyone to help him or rest and Bakugo wanting the very opposite) and of course, the thematic parallels are all there https://t.co/BYphqmqo8T

Before I continue let's take a look at the setting and other factors 

- Ground Zero at Kamino Ward
- All Might statue is in the background
- Next chapter (Chp 319) is exactly 100 chapters from Deku vs Kacchan Part 2 (Chp. 219) https://t.co/BXST4LMyFa

So I think while its showing the 2nd user to believe Bakugo would help strengthen Deku potentially supporting him 

In reality, Bakugo would be against the very mindset entirely, and he wouldnt just join Deku in the fight but would try and convince him to stop and let others help

We have seen Bakugo show concern for Deku and his destructive mindset in the past. I mean, look at him here, he gets that Deku is self-destructive and he at least somewhat understands why https://t.co/tKyR4bXI9L

It's apart of Bakugo's character development that he no longer believes in doing things completely on his own. He used to not want to take help from Deku or rlly anyone but we see how he has grown from that https://t.co/VlmW5zJM90

BUT - I think this is a red herring by Horikoshi.

Because we have seen Bakugo be VERY AGAINST the idea of Deku going alone. He has shown concern in the past. And we know for a fact that Bakugo is working with other people (most likely 2-A kids like Ochako, Todoroki, Iida, etc)

The reason I think this is a possibility (however unlikely) is because the 2nd makes it seem as if Bakugo would be one to strengthen Deku but not change the mindset/inaction he has shown.

Which would mean Bakugo would somehow help 
Deku without changing that entire mindset https://t.co/R3KfDuKSlc

I can see this leading to a few different things.

First, the less likely one that I think could happen. Bakugo saves Deku from Dictator - Deku promptly thanks him but then tries to leave on his own again, and Bakugo simply forces himself in and tags along to support him anyways

So here is the dilemma that faces the story. You have one character very against the idea of Deku going at it alone. And you have Deku, who 1 chapter ago forced All Might out of his life in order to shoulder that burden by himself

These are two largely clashing ideologies https://t.co/lTMxQaVd4c

To be a bit meta here: You don't completely give your character a 180 within 1 chapter. From a writing standpoint, you don't build a character slowly descending into his breaking point only for him to throw it away off of 1 chapter. 

i.e. Deku isn't about to be "saved" right now

So it's safe to assume that even if Deku doesnt want Bakugo there, he's gonna (at least try to) stick around. 

But the thing is, in 317 Deku pushed away ALL MIGHT. This chapter he continued to deny help from Endeavor and other heroes claiming he is fine and continuing to push on https://t.co/FPc1DxGuJF

Now we can factor in Bakugo, who is someone who won't take no for an answer.

For example, back in the war arc Bakugo chose to go with Deku when he broke off to save everyone from Shigaraki - even when Deku showed disapproval of this Bakugo forced it anyways https://t.co/7edqkJfVbf

The 2nd user on the other hand seems to be with Izuku on his mindset. He explains how he thinks his inaction is a must

BUT - he then goes on to say how if anything can strengthen him right now it would be 

(implied to be Bakugo through parallels and direct imagery) https://t.co/ES0wszXzgO

To understand what the 2nd is talking about we need to understand not only his mindset but also Bakugo's.

We know for a fact that Bakugo is VERY against the idea of Deku trying to accomplish/win all on his own. We see this from back in the war when Bakugo saves Deku https://t.co/ddNI9bAD1L

Deku in 317 Pushed Away All Might. We see his mindset of doing it all himself and pushing others away for their safety is getting even worse.

Bakugo shows up in 319. The 2nd alludes to him being one who can "Bolster" Deku.

But what does that mean exactly? https://t.co/bZ34Lm4Izi
